channel.title: Bloomberg Technology

item.title: TSMC Supplier GlobalWafers Hikes US Spending to $7.5 Billion
item.description: Taiwanese chip materials maker GlobalWafers Co plans to raise its investments in the US to $7.5 billion, sating increasing demand as President Donald Trump tries to boost advanced manufacturing at home.
item.dc:creator: Jane Lanhee Lee

media:content.media:description: HSINCHU, TAIWAN - SEPTEMBER 16: A closeup of a silicon wafer on display at Taiwan Semiconductor Research Institution on September 16, 2022 in Hsinchu, Taiwan. Taiwan's semiconductor manufacturing capabilities are crucial to global supply chains, with megacap companies like Apple, Nvidia and Qualcomm heavily dependent on the island's exports. Taiwan accounts for some 60 percent of global semiconductor foundry revenue, according to media reports. (Photo by Annabelle Chih/Getty Images)

item.title: The Saudis' Bet on AI Plumbing Needs More Plumbers
item.description: Huge plans to become a hub for AI infrastructure could fizzle without enough software innovation and talent.
item.dc:creator: Parmy Olson

media:content.media:description: Elon Musk and Nvidia Corp. CEO Jensen Huang (center) are directed to greet the Saudi crown prince in Riyadh on May 13, 2025.

item.title: Alibaba’s Letdown Tempers the Outlook for China’s Tech Revival
item.description: China’s long-moribund tech sector started 2025 with a bang.
item.dc:creator: Charlotte Yang, Claire Che, Luz Ding

item.title: ByteDance Aims to Match Meta Sales in 2025 as TikTok Gains Steam
item.description: ByteDance Ltd. is targeting revenue growth of about 20% in 2025 despite a potential global economic downturn, a pace of expansion that could help it match Meta Platforms Inc.’s global business.
item.dc:creator: Zheping Huang, Min Jeong Lee

media:content.media:description: The TikTok logo on a smartphone arranged in the Queens borough of New York, US, on Wednesday, Jan. 15, 2025. The Supreme Court signaled it's likely to uphold a law that would ban the popular TikTok social media platform in the US if it isn't sold by its Chinese parent company by Jan. 19. Photographer: Gabby Jones/Bloomberg

item.title: Baidu, Bilibili, Lenovo Report as US-China Trade Tensions Ease
item.description: Baidu Inc., Bilibili Inc. and Lenovo Group Ltd. are among the Chinese tech firms in focus for next week’s earnings, just as the easing US-China trade war brings back some optimism for the sector.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Yeo, Justina T Lee, Harshita Swaminathan, Reina Sasaki

media:content.media:description: A screen demonstrates a Taichi learning software utilizing AI and motion capture technology during the Baidu Inc. Create AI Developer Conference in Wuhan, China, on Friday, April 25, 2025. Baidu unveiled upgrades to its flagship AI models and slashed their prices as it looks to take on rivals like Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. and DeepSeek in China's increasingly competitive artificial intelligence market.

item.title: FTC Rests at Meta Monopoly Trial, Shifting Focus to Defense
item.description: The Federal Trade Commission wrapped up its case Thursday for breaking up Meta Platforms Inc. as an illegal social-media monopoly, with the company now set to lay out its defense in the ongoing antitrust trial.
item.dc:creator: Josh Sisco

media:content.media:description: Mark Zuckerberg, chief executive officer of Meta Platforms Inc., arrives at federal court in Washington, DC, US, on Wednesday, April 16, 2025. The Federal Trade Commission alleges the acquisitions of Instagram in 2012 and WhatsApp in 2014 have given the company now known as Meta Platforms Inc. a social media monopoly, and is fighting to break up the company.

item.title: Vistra Makes AI Power Bet With $1.9 Billion Gas Deal
item.description: Vistra Corp. agreed to buy seven natural gas-fired power plants for $1.9 billion, the latest big US generator betting on the fossil fuel to feed the voracious appetite of artificial intelligence.
item.dc:creator: Mark Chediak, Naureen S Malik

media:content.media:description: Vapor rises from chimney's at a power plant. Photographer: Bloomberg Creative Photos/Bloomberg

item.title: Chinese Startup Trials First AI Doctor Clinic in Saudi Arabia
item.description: A Chinese startup has opened the world’s first clinic in Saudi Arabia where artificial intelligence diagnoses patients, a key step in replacing human doctors as the first line of medical treatment.
item.dc:creator: Karoline Kan

media:content.media:description: AI “doctor” named “Dr. Hua.” Source: Synyi AI

item.title: Coinbase Hack Rocks the Company That Led Crypto Into Mainstream
item.description: On the long list of crypto companies that have been hacked, there are plenty of examples of financial losses that are much more painful than what Coinbase Global Inc. appears to be facing from the attack it disclosed on Thursday.
item.dc:creator: Margi Murphy, Emily Nicolle

media:content.media:description: The Coinbase website on a smartphone.

item.title: Microsoft’s CEO on How AI Will Remake Every Company, Including His
item.description: Nervous customers and a volatile partnership with OpenAI are complicating things for Satya Nadella and the world’s most valuable company.
item.dc:creator: Austin Carr, Dina Bass

media:content.media:description: Nadella.

item.title: Applied Materials Gives Tepid Forecast as China Sales Slip
item.description: Applied Materials Inc., the largest American maker of chip-manufacturing equipment, gave a lackluster forecast for the current period, highlighting the potential cost of the US trade dispute with China.
item.dc:creator: Ian King

media:content.media:description: Signage outside Applied Materials headquarters in Santa Clara, California, U.S., on Thursday, May 13, 2021. Applied Materials Inc. is expected to release earnings figures on May 20. Photographer: David Paul Morris/Bloomberg

item.title: Goldman Sees AI Investment Boosting Structured Finance
item.description: Companies are seeking vast amounts of capital for a wide range of artificial intelligence-linked projects, including building data centers and fiber optic networks, creating demand for funding in structured finance markets.
item.dc:creator: Scott Carpenter

media:content.media:description: Steven Moffitt and John Greenwood

item.title: Trump and His Allies Pave Way for Unconstrained AI Development
item.description: The White House and some Republicans in Congress have begun to lay the groundwork for a new AI era with far less regulation. But first...
item.dc:creator: Shirin Ghaffary

media:content.media:description: RIYADH, SAUDI ARABIA - MAY 14: U.S. President Donald Trump and Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman speak as they arrive during the Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC) Leaders’ Summit at The Ritz-Carlton on May 14, 2025 in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia. The council addresses regional stability, defense cooperation, and energy policy among Gulf nations. Trump is on a multi-nation tour of the Gulf region focused on expanding economic ties and reinforcing security cooperation with key U.S. allies. (Photo by Win McNamee/Getty Images)

item.title: iPhone Supplier TDK Readies Batteries Geared for Thin AI Gadgets
item.description: TDK Corp. is readying a new generation of batteries to power smartphones through AI tasks at a time that major client Apple Inc. is also preparing to launch a slimmer handset.
item.dc:creator: Takashi Mochizuki, Yuki Furukawa

media:content.media:description: Noboru Saito in Tokyo on Dec. 24.

item.title: Christian Dior Couture Client Data Breached in Cyber Attack
item.description: Christian Dior Couture has been hit by a cyber attack, with hackers obtaining some of its customers’ data.
item.dc:creator: Angelina Rascouet

media:content.media:description: Signage at a Christian Dior SE store on Rodeo Drive in Beverly Hills, California, US, on Wednesday, April 30, 2025. Luxury groups including LVMH Moet Hennessy Louis Vuitton SE have warned that they'll raise prices to offset the US tariffs imposed earlier this month. Photographer: Eric Thayer/Bloomberg

item.title: Meta Shares Slip on Report That It’s Delaying Flagship AI Model
item.description: Meta Platforms Inc. shares declined on a report that the social networking company is delaying a flagship artificial intelligence model, sparking concerns about its AI push.
item.dc:creator: Nick Turner

media:content.media:description: Meta headquarters in Menlo Park, California, US, on Tuesday, Jan 28, 2025. Meta Platforms Inc. is scheduled to release earnings figures on January 29. Photographer: David Paul Morris/Bloomberg

item.title: Trump Wants US iPhone Production, EToro CEO on IPO | Bloomberg Technology
item.description: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow discuss President Trump’s call for Apple to stop moving iPhone production to India and instead shift it to the US. Plus, eToro CEO Yoni Assia talks about the company’s market debut. And CoreWeave CEO Michael Intrator discusses the expanded partnership with OpenAI and the company’s first earnings report since going public. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: EU Digital Chief Defends Bloc’s Tech Regulation
item.description: European Commissioner for Tech Sovereignty, Security and Democracy Henna Virkkunen talks about the EU’s efforts to shape the future of digital competition and innovation as she meets with CEOs and officials in Silicon Valley and Washington, D.C. She joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Technology.” (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Trading Platform EToro Makes Its Market Debut
item.description: EToro CEO Yoni Assia discusses the company’s upsized IPO and how it differentiates itself from competitor Robinhood. Assia joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Technology.” (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Inference Use Is ‘Most Important’ AI Trend: CoreWeave
item.description: CoreWeave CEO Michael Intrator discusses the company’s expanded $4 billion cloud deal with OpenAI and its first earnings report since going public. He joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Technology.” (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Trump Asks Apple to Trade India iPhone Production for US
item.description: Bloomberg’s Mark Gurman discusses why President Donald Trump says he’d like Apple to stop moving iPhone production to India, and what he’d like to see instead. Gurman joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Technology”. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: ‘Grand Theft Auto’ Delay Fails to Dent Take-Two Investor Zeal
item.description: Investors in Take-Two Interactive Software Inc. won’t see the latest Grand Theft Auto VI game hit the shelves this year like previously planned, but that isn’t souring sentiment on the stock.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Vlastelica

media:content.media:description: Grand Theft Auto VI.

item.title: France and Spain Want to Impose Age Limits on Social Media Networks
item.description: France, Spain and Greece are pushing for mandatory age restrictions for users of social networks including Meta Platforms Inc.’s Facebook and Elon Musk’s X, according to a document seen by Bloomberg.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Basteiro

item.title: ServiceNow Loses Top Sales Leaders in Executive Shuffle
item.description: Two top ServiceNow Inc. leaders are leaving the software company as it reshapes the upper ranks of its sales division.
item.dc:creator: Brody Ford

media:content.media:description: ServiceNow Inc. signage during the Nvidia GPU Technology Conference (GTC) in San Jose, California, US, on Thursday, March 20, 2025. Nvidia Corp., whose products have fueled a flood of artificial intelligence spending, said new types of AI models that produce more complex answers will only increase the need for computing infrastructure.

item.title: OpenAI Grows CoreWeave Tie-Up With New $4 Billion Cloud Deal
item.description: CoreWeave Inc. has secured a deal worth as much as $4 billion to provide additional cloud computing capacity to artificial intelligence leader OpenAI, expanding a tie-up between the two firms.
item.dc:creator: Edward Ludlow, Redd Brown

media:content.media:description: CoreWeave Inc. signage in Times Square in New York, US, on Friday, May 9, 2025. After a heavily scaled down initial public offering, CoreWeave Inc. is in discussions to raise about $1.5 billion in debt, according to a person with knowledge of the matter.

item.title: We Should Know Who's Paying for Geoengineering Experiments
item.description: Funding is growing as rapidly as the public discourse around its research and development, but it’s not a climate-change solution.
item.dc:creator: Lara Williams

media:content.media:description: High expectations.

item.title: Sony Debuts Foldable ‘M6’ Headphones With Better Noise Cancellation
item.description: The $450 WH-1000XM6 are a much-anticipated update to the company’s wireless over-ear model.
item.dc:creator: Dana Wollman

media:content.media:description: Sony’s WH-1000XM6 headphones

item.title: Benioff Buys Stake in Influencer Agency Whalar Group at $400 Million Valuation
item.description: Company represents over 300 TikTok, Instagram and YouTube creators
item.dc:creator: Aisha Counts

media:content.media:description: Marc Benioff, chief executive officer of Salesforce Inc., speaks during a keynote at the 2024 Dreamforce conference in San Francisco, California, US, on Tuesday, Sept. 17, 2024. Salesforce is unveiling a pivot in its artificial intelligence strategy this week at its annual Dreamforce conference, now saying that its AI tools can handle tasks without human supervision and changing the way it charges for software.

item.title: Deutsche Telekom Beats Estimates as German Competition Rises
item.description: Deutsche Telekom AG’s first quarter profit topped estimates, demonstrating the resilience of the carrier’s mobile business in its home market of Germany even as competition cut into its broadband subscribers.
item.dc:creator: Jillian Deutsch

media:content.media:description: A sign outside a Deutsche Telekom AG store in Berlin.

item.title: Trump’s Rush to Cut AI Deals in Saudi Arabia and UAE Opens Rift With China Hawks
item.description: President Donald Trump’s flurry of artificial intelligence deals during his tour of the Middle East is opening a rift within his own administration as China hawks grow increasingly concerned the projects are putting US national security and economic interests at risk.
item.dc:creator: Mackenzie Hawkins, Jenny Leonard

media:content.media:description: Donald Trump and Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman arrive at the Gulf Cooperation Council Leaders’ Summit in Riyadh on May 14.
